alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 7:23PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mecklenburg, Cumberland, Prince Edward, Lunenburg, Nottoway, southwestern Goochland, Amelia and Powhatan Counties through 800 PM EST... At 721 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Andersonville to near Saxe to near Semora. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Guinea Mills around 735 PM EST. Cumberland around 740 PM EST. Sunnyside around 745 PM EST. Lunenburg, Buffalo Springs, Ballsville and Tobaccoville around 750 PM EST. Victoria, Clarksville, Trenholm, Macon and Green Bay around 755 PM EST. Powhatan, Goochland, Crewe, Nottoway, Burkeville and Boydton around 800 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Tuggle, Wilburn, Angola, Arvins Store, Murdocks, Maidens, Nutbush, Finneywood and Hawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward
